body:
Welcome to the BPA-CSIRO workshops project on GitHub. 
This serves as a landing page for the various training workshops organised and maintained by BPA-CSIRO.
An overview of the training workshops and included training modules are described below. 
For the latest upcoming BPA-CSIRO workshops, please visit the Bioplatforms
 Australia [training page][bpa-workshops].

## Getting Started

To get started on how to reuse existing BTP workshops or develop new workshops,
please visit the [BTP Workshop Template][btp-workshop-template] page on GitHub. 
To know how the BTP images and instances are created and launched, 
please visit the [BTP Orchestration][btp-orchestration] page on GitHub.

## [Introduction to Next Generation Sequencing Hands-on Workshop][btp-workshop-ngs]

This is a practical 3 day hands-on course designed for bench biologists, 
PhD students or early career postdoctoral researchers with no or 
basic bioinformatics experience who are planning or currently using
NGS approaches in their research area. 
It will include a half-day introduction to the command line interface.
The list of training modules included in this workshop is listed below.

| Training Modules                                 |
|:-------------------------------------------------|
| [Data Quality][btp-module-ngs-qc]                |
| [Read Alignment][btp-module-ngs-mapping]         |
| [ChIP-Seq][btp-module-ngs-chipseq]               |
| [RNA-Seq][btp-module-ngs-rnaseq]                 |
| [de novo Genome Assembly][btp-module-ngs-denovo] |

The `Introduction to Next Generation Sequencing Hands-on Workshop` image can be 
launched on the NeCTAR Research Cloud and Amazon Web Services cloud (AWS) platforms.
For the NeCTAR Research Cloud, the latest image is: (image name: `BTP-2016-01-25`,
`image id: 9c7fd8ac-5cfe-4067-aae3-82e53a49def3`). A detailed guide on launching
the image on the NeCTAR Research Cloud is available [here][btp-orch-nectar-launch]. 
On AWS, the image (AMI) is available on the following regions: 
(ap-southeast-2: `ami-be597ddd`, au-west-1: `ami-d3a31ea0`). A detailed guide for
launching the image on AWS is also available [here][btp-orch-aws-launch].
Stand-alone images are also available for VirtualBox and VMWare.
The stand-alone images are downloadable from [here][bpa-ngs-releases].
